Key Match Events: Shaheen Shah Afridi took 4 for 22 in his four overs
Shakib Al Hasan was adjudged lbw on field, and upheld on DRS even though he was absolutely certain he'd nicked the ball
Mohammad Haris played a crucial innings of 31 off 18 balls
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan cranked up the deja vu in Adelaide on Sunday as they sailed into the T20 World Cup semi-finals
This game wouldn't even have played out this way if not for Netherlands shocking South Africa
Shakib Al Hasan was distraught after being given out lbw
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Adelaide pitch wasn't great for strokeplay. Batters kept trying to hit out but it just wasn't happening
Taskin Ahmed, who could have had a wicket in his first over if not for a bad fumble from the wicketkeeper Nurul Hasan, overstepped
Others: Bangladesh were 70 for 1 after 10 overs. Then they lost their captain and could manage only 127 for 8
Pakistan are into the knockouts now. They even returned the favour to Netherlands, giving them a great chance of finishing fourth in Group 2 which ensures they will play the next T20 World Cup
